contextId.information: Zerubbabel oversees the building of the temple. The building is referred to as "his hands" even though his own hands may not have laid the stones. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: The hands of Zerubbabel ... his hands will bring it to completion

contextId.information: AT: "the people of the land of Hamath" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
God is speaking to the people of two different nations at the same time. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: I have roused your sons, Zion, against your sons, Greece

contextId.information: The Israelites will defeat the soldiers who fight with slingshots. These soldiers represent all the enemies of Israel, no matter what weapons they are carrying. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: defeat the stones of the slings
who trample their enemies into the mud of the streets in battle

contextId.information: Here "the majesty of Assyria" probably refers to the Assyrian army. AT: "I will destroy Assyria's proud army." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: The majesty of Assyria will be brought down

contextId.information: AT: "allow each person to be controlled by another person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: turn over every person into the hand of his neighbor

contextId.information: Here "tents" represents homes, and homes represent the people who live in them. AT: "the people of Judah." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This refers to all the people living in the land of Judah. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

contextId.quote: his feet will stand on the Mount of Olives
the hand of one will be raised up against the hand of another
